@MarshaCollier @OpenAI @sarbjeetjohal @eric_kavanagh @AkwyZ @antgrasso @joemckendrick @rwang0 @paulg @nyike Agree, Marsha. I made that point in the interview. The carbon footprint for creating the #AI models and operating them in daily use is far larger than search.

It's big enough so that there will certainly be significant questions raised, like it has been with #crypto mining. #ESG

Just gave an interview about the implications of #GenerativeAI in the workplace. My thoughts.

Still very early days, but potential for upside/downside disruption is very significant.

Democratized #AI becoming a global phenomenon + change how we work forever.

#FutureOfWork https://t.co/UIvDB98osI

@BillMew @dez_blanchfield @rwang0 @sarbjeetjohal @robmay70 @holgermu @shanebrighton @fogle_shane @antgrasso @AkwyZ @imoyse @NeilCattermull @sallyeaves @askquantum My take: An actual Q-day won't happen. Encryption won't go obsolete, b/c quantum-resistant methods have emerged (@NIST has announced 4) + #quantumcomputing can be used to encrypt, not just decrypt.

No, the real problem will be upgrading every server in the world to these.

“We learned we could actually make complexity dealt with trend up in @Atlassian by enabling new #collaboration norms, and continuing the positive trajectory of teams that we saw at the beginning of this distributed architecture journey.” - @Andrew_boyagi
#AtlassianPresentsUnleash https://t.co/is0uQr5TY5

Interesting that @Atlassian has a dedicated white hat/red team to constantly seek out security vulnerabilities. 

One of the many reasons why #cloud is typically more secure than on-premises.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash #cybersecurity #trust https://t.co/AXsw2TSV3N

An interesting nuanced argument that multi-tenant architectures actually allow you to scale #trust, by the Chief Trust Officer of @Atlassian.

My take: It can be explained/justified, but is takes time for the market to appreciate + understand this.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash https://t.co/tXgSMPtcNF

“The bulk of [@Atlassian’s] #innovation is going into the #cloud. We want to make sure that every single one of our customers has no technical, legal, or business reason to not adopt our technology.”

And to be able trust that cloud is a viable path.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash https://t.co/0Lwahfcqnh

Fireside chat on how @Atlassian established a #trust office and created a Chief Trust Officer role.

“It was a realization that it's not enough just to build security of our products in order to attain trust.”

My take: Trust the currency of #cloud.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash https://t.co/PDCDi086DV

Summary of how @Atlassian #Compass raises the complexity limit that devs can handle with #microservices architectures:

- Easy findability/info w/ a component catalog
- #Governance and scorecards
- #Extensibility and app marketplace

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash #EntArch https://t.co/kBWmjFApoO
@robertcastaneda @Atlassian @mbizovi I am right in the front row upstairs. Come and say hi!

- Single pane of glass for all info
- #DevOps health
- Templates
- #Ecosystem

- Brought tools together
- Devs can build what they need
- Low cognitive load for new tools

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash #microservices #EntArch https://t.co/Q1rkNxgRmQ

A very intriguing view of the @Atlassian platform engineering team.

Used plug-ins as one way to lift the complexity limit of a modern #microservices architecture. 

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash https://t.co/sG6cpj9Yvh

The component scorecards in #Compass are very interesting.

Can ensure standards, compliance, #governance, and security needs are met and make it clear what needs to be done.

Helps create a healthy engineering culture.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash #EntArch #cio #cto https://t.co/S2dAuSnWS0

“The @Atlassian component catalog has created an information on demand culture.” - @Andrew_boyagi 

In #Compass, devs + architects can see activity of a component & all up/downstream dependencies. All the context on the software component in one place.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash https://t.co/Z5YWXablkF

The @Atlassian journey to #microservices “was more of a you build it, you help run it the model w/ platform engineering helping out.” - @tpechacek 

Struggled with reliability + incidents that involve several different code bases owned by various teams.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash https://t.co/pYGnu7hTjy

Product lead @tpechacek and evangelist @Andrew_boyagi.

Going to learn about the firm’s journey to #microservices, which led to creating Compass.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash https://t.co/ALvMf5EOk8

Correction: You can request access today for the security tab in @Jira when it does come out in beta, likely at the end of March. 

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash

You have to change your thinking a bit to move to continuous product discovery.

Accepting the possibility of failure changes the process very much of #productmanagement in a powerful way
says @tanguycrusson. 

@Jira Product Discovery 

#AtlassianPresentsUnleashed https://t.co/tLGJLCkuGl

Then @tanguycrusson sought the right time to go from 100 to 1000 users to validate product-market fit using data.

“Until we were convinced that we landed on the right solution, there is little point in investing in making it scale at that point.”

#AtlassianPresentsUnleashed https://t.co/uEpaoyJDIY

Fascinating exploration of how to achieve product-market fit using a small audience by @tanguycrusson using actual data and evidence-based learning.

From the work on the new @Jira Product Discovery.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleashed #productmanagement https://t.co/oF8beeDrJQ

Now @tanguycrusson compares the growth funnel with something called the safety funnel, which is a way to reduce the number of people who have a bad experience. 

Key for adding major enhancements to an existing product.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleashed #productmanagement #cto https://t.co/WhWQ9BuQer

“We started thinking about something for creating a space for discussing priorities that is friendly for stakeholders. We started thinking how we might help product managers run a discovery.” - @tanguycrusson on journey of new @Jira Product Discovery

#AtlassianPresentsUnleashed https://t.co/a54ZVPubOn

The key shifts of product discovery:

Requirements -> Goals
Yearly planning process -> Continuous prioritization
Output-based roadmaps -> Outcome-based roadmaps
Top-down decisions -> Learning-based decisions

#AtlassianPresentsUnleashed #productmanagement @tanguycrusson https://t.co/OmRXZOlWxm

Product discovery is the act of assessing continuously what a team should be focusing on that is based on learnings, not opinions, and not top down decisions without data says @tanguycrusson.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleashed #productmanagement #appdev https://t.co/mU08lFqOaU

Most product ideas fail and even the ones that don’t “will take many more iterations to get right than what you were expecting for it to actually deliver the value you're expecting.” - @tanguycrusson 

#AtlassianPresentsUnleashed #productmanagement #cto @Jira https://t.co/4xncAhhN3K

Wonder, explore, make, impact, scaling.

“Each stage is meant to ask the right questions at the right moment. Each of them is designed with failure in mind. So we have clear choice to decide whether we should continue, pivot, etc.” - @tanguycrusson 

#AtlassianPresentsUnleashed https://t.co/deNjEdw2Gh

“We must make way for the ideas that will succeed.” - @tanguycrusson on the discipline required in #productmanagement to ensure resources are available to really innovate on what matters.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleashed #innovation @Jira https://t.co/N8iyvP44wK

The head of product for the new @Jira Product Discovery, @tanguycrusson, is up now at #AtlassianPresentsUnleashed talking about this important new way of expanding the product management #collaboration envelope.

#DevOps #productmanagement https://t.co/noGyhgmiDp

Exploring @Alassian Compass for capturing unified real-time representation of engineering output. Compass provides (among other things):

- Component catalog
- #DevOps best practices
- Extensibility 

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash @meganwcook https://t.co/45XenOfHo7

“So modern software is no longer written, it's assembled. There has been a shift in application architecture to #microservices, with a whole host of new challenges and developer routines.” - @meganccook.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash #DevOps #agile https://t.co/pOEXGLkWgS

Noting the challenges between devs seeking to add features, vs. plugging security vulnerabilities, @meganwcook talks about the new security tab, available in beta today, to make it easy to surface and track them.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash #ciso #DevOps https://t.co/7AI0yW7JuT

Now @meghanwcook notes that average org spends 10% of effort on maintaining tool chain. 

“Software teams must collaborate, not just cooperate. 

Everyone on the team can use the tools that suite them best [in an open tool chain].”

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash #DevOps https://t.co/AkB1jBD1SD

So far, the laser focus on today’s announcements on seamless tool chain/value stream integration, tool choice, and high developer #productivity has been crisp and distinct at #AtlassianPresentsUnleash. 

My take: This is what devs + orgs both need and are seeking. https://t.co/B53r1dEUbj

“You could ask 100 dev teams how they set up their workflows + you'll get 100 different answers. What if you could copy workflows from teams + companies who have already been there?” asks @justinemoore99, continuing day’s theme of high dev productivity.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash https://t.co/kVsPjsKnwC

“@Jira should be a system of record for devs, not a system of engagement. You want developers focused on developing, not finishing a story + then recording that they finished the story.” - @justinemoore99 re: updating #Jira right in the IDE.

#AtlassianPresentsUnleash #agile https://t.co/LxrU6AScQC

- #Atlas (status)

- Jira Work Management
- Jira Product Discovery <— *new*

@Jira Product Discovery

The sad truth is the most data investments take time to do well. Should be done 1-2 years before reductions come.

In other words, if there’s a recession in 2023, as is likely, most big payoff data strategies should have been started in 2021 or so.

But we live/learn.

#CIOChat

A5: Data investments are foundational. They pyramid up into every part of #IT + the business.

They are highly strategic, provide high leverage, and sustained long term payoff.

All my research says investments will more that offset reductions. Though not at same time.

#CIOChat

A4: Moving people to ways of thinking about/managing data:

- Articulate vision (art-of-the-possible)
- Storytell possibilities/success stories
- Fund + enable everyone to change
- Educate
- Comms, comms, comms
- Lead by example (use data well)
- Effective rewards

#CIOChat #cio

A3: Best data architecture options today, in rough order:

- Domain-based data graph/#microservices
- BI/#analytics platform
- #APIs
- Data platform/#cloud
- #Datalakes
- #Masterdata/#CDP store
- Databases
- #ESB

And no one option sufficient. More like most of them.

@joannefriedman @MylesSuer Oh yes, a 2nd wave of #cloud (or whichever wave you call it) resulting in a far more heterogeneous #cloud provider environment that serves customer needs for control over geography, national boundaries, data residency, regulation, latency, #edge reqs, and other factors.

#CIOChat

@S_dF Exactly. The term ‘center’ has lost much of its meaning in an area of increasingly maximal #decentralization.

Everything is becoming nodes or groups of nodes.

With #zerotrust architectures, much is highly isolated anyway. Time to stop thinking of centers.

#CIOChat #zta #cloud

A5: I’d turn that elephant into bite-sized pieces.

Find most important — to the business — or costly (to keep spare capacity for) workloads.

Then run mini-business cases.

Prioritize by level of effort/risk.

Execute steadily until done.

Do rest opportunistically.

#CIOChat

@joannefriedman @MylesSuer I find it interesting #cloud prices don’t track Moore’s Law closely.

On-premises #datacenters benefit more directly from the big increases in compute power happening regularly.

But #hyperscaler tier such a competitive business, the divided is kept to expand + grow.

#CIOChat

A4: To a real extent, the #CIO hasn’t so much lost their resistance as resigned themselves to the inexorable shift to #cloud. 

Fact remains there’s a vast enterprise #data diaspora to the cloud.

Now the imperative is find way to get arms around the cloud data estate.

#CIOChat

A3: The answers depends on the situation/use case, so YMMV. 

But likely to be one of these:

- Agility
- Time to value (instant on)
- Modern #IT stack (full #cloudnative, etc.)
- Elasticity (ramp up/down)
- Security <- Yes, #cloud more secure
- #Talent availability

#CIOChat

A2: Top factors for retaining #datacenters (or using #edge capabilities), in rough order:

- Systems that must run offline
- Ultra secure systems (national security)
- Use cases that overwhelm backhaul (data too big)
- Hyper low latency (trading systems)
- Cheaper in DC

#CIOChat

This increasingly is becoming a top requirement for #cloud stacks:

Don’t lock in your customer.

Or they’ll hedge their bets with everything they have.

#CIOChat #cio

@MylesSuer @S_dF @awscloud Agree, for smaller #IT departments, public #cloud (both #IaaS and #SaaS) is the way. #Datacenters don’t compute. Just the #cybersecurity risk alone of loose servers makes it a no-go.

#CIOChat

A1: In general, #IT workloads should be situated where it makes the most sense from a performance, cost, and control POV.

If you can dispatch as needed, to #cloud or #datacenter, that’s ideal.

But increasingly #serverless makes this a dynamic run-time optimization.

#CIOChat

Modern data strategy vision is required!

- Create a go-to-market plan 
- Productize strategic data sets
- Help monetize them
- Determine evolution and future growth

- Reward data-driven behavior
- Lead by example

A5: Top tips for a #CIO wanting to foster #innovation.

- Allow + reward experimentation 
- Budget time and resources, not just a project or two
- Allow anyone to participate (be inclusive)
- Offer #IT specific models (competitions, #hackathons, etc.)
- Storytell!

@DigitalSecArch @davidseidl @MylesSuer Good Q. My take: #Innovation can happen in any facet of the business/product lifecycle.

ideation->R&D->design->production->test->Q&A, etc.

The difference between iteration and innovation tends to be more qualitative than quantitative.

i.e. Something genuinely new.

#CIOChat

A1: If any activity is, #innovation is a team sport. 

That said, the best ideas are often where you least expect them (outside your bubble.)

It is critical to harness innovation as widely and deeply in the org -- and outside of it -- as possible.

Tools can help.

Given that the world has changed + enterprise digital capabilities keep growing, it’s worth doing a post-mortem on my @TAP_Portugal flight.

Airlines have many digital options to help their flyers. But much too often don’t use them.

I’ll post an #MVP on modern airline #cx soon.

We were supposed to take off 25 mins ago on @TAP_Portugal flight TP402 on 8/6.

Not a single status update.

No staff visible at the gate.

If this was the only trouble I had on this journey that might be Ok once. But not after the whole ordeal.

Do not fly.

#cx

So, best low cost, high quality alternatives to @TAP_Portugal at this point I’d say now are:

- @emirates
- @qatarairways 
- @lufthansa 
- @TurkishAirlines 
- @FlySWISS 

No airline is perfect, but the above have surprisingly good #cx, and increasingly in the digital realm too.

Now, to be fair, they did have someone meet me when their inbound flight arrived late in #Lisbon, w/ a boarding pass for a new connecting flight (this one.) 

Presumably because I’m @staralliance Gold.

But this is unlike the @TAP_Portugal pre-pandemic. They’ve gone lax.

#cx

We were supposed to have left a while ago now. But not a single status or update. Children crying.

This is flight TP402 on August 6th. No concern for customer needs, schedules, or making everyone jump around on their published times, but doing apparently nothing.

#cx #csat

I’m talking elderly people, families with little kids, all stressed out.

This is terrible #customerexperience and I’ve never seen it at any other airport.

Combined with @AirportLisbon’s extremely long immigration lines for non-EU customers, I have to rescind my must-fly stance.

Hey, @AirportLisbon and @TAP_Portugal, your gate notification system is horrendous.

You only announce the gate five minutes before boarding, for a gate 15 minutes away.

Then when everyone gallops there, no staff are at the gate.

Every time.

@ourmiereschris @JFVNunes #airports

Q. As most enterprise software moves to #cloud/#SaaS, when will vendors offer invaluable cross-industry insights, benchmarks? Even business coaching from the data? What’s stopping them?

A. Sensitivity of data, data ownership, opt-in complexity, trust. And product silos.

My take: It’s too early for the industry to create #REITs or even to arbitrage #cloud services. The industry not mature enough, services still evolving, and 2nd/3rd tier players not strong enough yet.

#Decentralization a wildcard too.

But all this will happen by end of decade.

When asked about which three technologies will have the most impact in the enterprise in the next 5 years, I said:

- #Automation/#AI/#4IR 
- Next-gen #cloud + #edge (#cloudnative, true #multicloud, #crosscloud, #5G #IoT, etc.)
- #Decentralization

This. The immutable record in a #blockchain makes it harder to be 'evil' in a given system that uses it.

Maximally and fully open #decentralization makes it more difficult to game the system and evident when you try.

#STinsights @CIOStraightTalk

@dinisguarda @CIOStraightTalk @RahulSingh50 @afigueiredo @PankajBikana @jeremyalmond Yes, I still run into those who think a #database can be used in lieu of #blockchain.

This is a misunderstanding of its immense power.

By allowing anyone full stake with a full copy of all the financial records, radical #decentralization creates buy-in and #trust.

#STinsights

A4: #Blockchain creates equity/inclusion in the #digitaleconomy by:

- Low barriers to participation
- Cost reduction (no/low fees)
- No gatekeepers (excluders)
- Radical #decentralization + transparency
- Usable from anywhere, by anyone
- Rules open/enforced by code

- Treat their biz as a #tech platform
- Design for #automation
- Architect for resilience
- Are platform/vendor independent
- Use CN constructs (#k8s, #microservices)
- Are always iterating
- Are polyglot cloud users
- Export complexity

I’ve been predicting this for a while:

- Inaccurate data
- Aged-out data
- Violations of compliance in privacy/regulatory (i.e. PII instead of anonymous GUIDs)
- Unwieldy data badly out of scope

A2: Biggest risks of a #cloud data migration:

- Source/target vendor lock-in
- Consistent performance
- Lower control
- Data quality/wrangling
- Regulatory issues (#GDPR)
- Cost monitoring/limiting
- Ability to move out/costs of data egress

Q5: What @mcdavis10 said. Start an AI #ethics carefully, as it will widen more than you expect. Be ready to learn a lot and adapt with alacrity.

And #ResponsibleAI and #EthicalAI are two key practices to begin with.

#CIOChat #cio #AI #governance

@mcdavis10 @ddkirsch Absolutely. These are the major issues of our time in reality.

We are exposing people and their data to highly sophisticated tech that can do countless things with the information they collect.

We have to be careful. And get consent.

Why #AI a quandary.

#CIOChat #EthicalAI

I'd also argue that there are actual skills that everybody needs to have around #AI. 

Some are fairly straightforward, if you're a general worker.

And some are more advanced.

But everyone need fluency and basic literacy on the topic. 

 #CIOChat #education #skills https://t.co/yJaIUjpxfo

A4: Top compliance challenges with algorithms + private #data:

- Not gaining consent
- Not monitoring/testing if compliant
- Leakage/theft of #PII 
- Misuse 
- Violating regs (i.e. #GDPR)
- Unintended consequences

#CIOChat #cio #AI #ML

A3: We're in early days in dealing with bias in #AI. We've learned how many there are, and learning how to respond.

In the end, the solution is likely to have generative systems create them outside of our biases.

@McKinsey has suggested approaches too.

#CIOChat #ResponsibleAI https://t.co/9zc2Z3gDNj

A2: The best companies + vendors I've worked with have ethics review of #AI usage and sales (if they're a vendor) and make sure the bad actors are not using this technology to exploit.

But more commonly, it's to safeguard the firm + their customers.

2/2

#CIOChat #EthicalAI

A2: The more powerful the tech, the more likely there are ethical and privacy issues.

But with #AI it's particularly fraught since the most interesting scenarios require that it have deep access to your business data, including customer information.

1/2

@mosesjones @MarkatMars @sarbjeetjohal @sandy_carter @efipm @rhappe @GlennGilmore @StevenDickens3 @chaumdotcom @dvellante @joemckendrick Dictatorship are not what this is about though. #Web3

@mosesjones @MarkatMars @sarbjeetjohal @sandy_carter @efipm @rhappe @GlennGilmore @StevenDickens3 @chaumdotcom @dvellante @joemckendrick Retraction/storage of papers can be handled. @mosesjones @MarkatMars @sarbjeetjohal @sandy_carter @efipm @rhappe @GlennGilmore @StevenDickens3 @chaumdotcom @dvellante @joemckendrick A far more effective way to change something is instead to transform the entire process it uses and put the tech in the center.

Make it the only way to get the work done.

That’s what #blockchain and #DAOs require: It’s all-in or all-out. One set of posted rules.

@CTOAdvisor @furrier @mattwbaker @sarbjeetjohal @mthiele10 @jerrychen @dvellante @digitalcloudgal @GurbaxaniVijay @matteastwood @tcrawford @nyike @AnuragTechaisle @Craw Yep. Let’s look at these super clouds and industrial clouds to see if they are actually creating clean, simpler, better higher-order cloud architectures. Because if not, they may provide some value add, but still with great learning curves, submerged obstacles, and complexities.

@sarbjeetjohal @mattwbaker @mthiele10 @jerrychen @dvellante @digitalcloudgal @furrier @GurbaxaniVijay @matteastwood @tcrawford @nyike @AnuragTechaisle @CTOAdvisor @Craw I’d say vertical “super clouds” often becoming industrial clouds. Even the hyperscalers have growing industrial “neighborhoods.”

At issue: Many industries want the #cloud to get within 90% of their business, so they can easily pour in their customization + differentiation.

@mattwbaker @sarbjeetjohal @mthiele10 @jerrychen @dvellante @digitalcloudgal @furrier @GurbaxaniVijay @matteastwood @tcrawford @nyike @AnuragTechaisle @CTOAdvisor @Craw What some might call fragmentation, others call decentralization.

There is a special art in composing existing #cloud services, then enriching them.

In fact, I’d argue there is a large industry evolving that is doing just that.

The winners will provide value with simplicity.

@joannefriedman I would hope latency would be accounted for in #QoS, but if it isn't then you are absolutely right.

A5: For #hybridcloud, #multicloud, and #edge the #CIO should use #MSPs for:

#CIOChat

A4: Tooling can very much help with #multicloud:

- Management of entire #cloud estate
- Routing workloads based on QoS/cost
- Onboarding/offboarding #CSPs
- Coping with operational exigencies
- Reducing dependencies and data sprawl

Still in infancy, though.

#CIOChat #cio

A3: #EntArch must lead #multicloud by setting standards + #MVP reference models for:

- #Cybersecurity guidelines
- #Masterdata rules
- #Cloud continuity + #DR
- Cross-cloud integration
- Minimizing single cloud dependencies
- How to: Cost-effective performant workloads

#CIOChat

A2: Great Q. #OKRs for #multicloud management. Depends on actual needs but:

- % sole dependency on single #cloud API/feature/function (lower better)
- % data w/ known + #API accessible #cloud location (higher better)
- % of workloads that can openly competed

#CIOChat #cio

Benefits of #quantumcomputing for most orgs:

- Disruptive #tech applicable to many business situations
- A new #innovation moat that a surprising number of orgs can’t cross for a while
- A way to leap-frog competition quickly
- A tool to supercharge key #IT systems

#STinsights

Challenges abound in next-gen of #digitaltransformation:

- Widespread talent shortages
- The major step-functions required to reach the next level
- Sustaining the scale/breadth required beyond quarterly cycles
- Managing resulting high #IT complexity
- Great ideas

#STinsights

@RadhikaGautam08 @Doug_Laney @rschu @kklive @JimHarris @CIOStraightTalk Largest short term benefits of #quantumcomputing:

- Algorithms that aren’t constrained by polynomial time
- 2-5 orders of magnitude or more of compute performance improvement
- New ways to think about and solve hard problems

All potentially highly disruptive.

#STinsights

@RathiChhaya @Doug_Laney @rschu @kklive @JimHarris @CIOStraightTalk Sure. Risks of not preparing for #quantumcomputing:

- Outdated, insecure infrastructure
- Poorly performing #IT compared to competitors
- Inability to seize new opportunities
- Sudden and large amounts of new #technicaldebt
- Outmoded talent 

#STinsights #digitaltransformation

A5: The clearest way to for the #CIO and #ChiefDataOfficer to collaborate is:

- #CIO manages technical #data concerns
- #CDO manages business data concerns

And collaborate closely on both sides of what is really the same coin but two different views/priorities.

#CIOChat

@tim_mcbreen I have somehow always believed that the #CIO was a misnomer. It aspired to #data, but became so many other things:

- Infrastructure
- Integration
- Intelligence
- Security
- Continuity

You name it. Data became just another role.

#CIOChat #cdo

@nyike Agree very much, Isaac. Ideally I'd want the #CIO and the #ChiefDataOfficer to be both best of friends and on the same page strategically. Though with slightly differing priorities.

#CIOChat #cdo

A4: Differentiated #ChiefDataOfficer skills:

- #Analytics + #datascience background
- Business strategy
- Compliance/regulatory knowledge
- #Innovation + #entrepreneur experience
- #Changeagent
- Transdisciplinary operator
- Iconoclast (breaks hold of data owners)

#CIOChat

@tim_mcbreen @DigitalSecArch @nyike That's what they tried with #ChiefDigitalOfficer. But most + more CIOs are ended up with the title.

But the #ChiefDataOfficer by definition far more business literate and focused. 

I don't think the #CIO is a good #CDO title owner (latter def). But can report to them.

#CIOChat

A3: In a perfect world, the #CIO provides the infrastructure, the data stores, operations and support for data-centric #IT.

While the #ChiefDataOfficer focuses on the business architecture, strategy, exploitation of data above the level of individual IT systems.

#CIOChat #cdo

@DigitalSecArch @nyike And yes, the #ChiefDataOfficer is sometimes a form of indictment that the #CIO has too many hats already.

#CIOChat #cdo

@DigitalSecArch @nyike It depends on the kind of business I'd argue. A tech firm whose job is primarily data might have the #ChiefDataOfficer report to #CTO.

A financial services company might have a different view, but it's probably to the business.

Data says 59% report to business leader.

A2: A challenge, as a infrastructure #CIO will constrain a #ChiefDataOfficer.

Big fork is where revenue comes from in the business.

If mostly from products: -> #CIO 

Not hard rules.

A3: The route to a #citizendeveloper community:

- Open community + toolkit
- Enable anyone to participate
- Call out loudly for participants
- Train/educate/enable them (with tools, education)
- Storytell successes
- Support + govern
- Capture lessons
- Iterate

#CIOChat #cio

@AndrewNebus @mthiele10 @nyike @_jfeldman @MylesSuer That's right. In #IT today, "rules for thee and not for me" now an outdated but still too common practice.

A1: Key #citizendeveloper tech:

- Robust #nocode/#lowcode platform w/ governance/guardrails/#masterdata
- Quality app/industry/function templates
- Support for best-in-class #cx designers, #cxm
- Training/#digitaladoption tools
- Tight integration with #ITSM, #ALM

#CIOChat #cio

@nyike @_jfeldman @mthiele10 @MylesSuer Unfortunately, those guardrails are the easiest to put up. Dr. No is a famous #CIO  persona for a very good reason.

A key issue has been #lowcode/#nocode tools lacking governance or are too limited, forcing #citizendevelopers into other tools.

Changing now however.

#CIOChat

@mthiele10 @ddkirsch +1. Poorly managed #lowcode/#nocode can result in exactly a #CIO fears: 

- Rogue apps that no one supports
- Duplicate/wrong/outdated data
- Poor integration
- Corrupted master data
- Support nightmares

All more avoidable than ever IMO. Love what @appsheet doing here.

#CIOChat

- Reducing the IT backlog
- Accelerating #digitaltransformation of the org
- Faster change

@BillMew @InfoWorld @sarbjeetjohal @rwang0 @Craw @tcrawford @holgermu @efeatherston @imoyse That's correct. All sorts of ways exist to hide, obfuscate, or miss completely the total cost of on-premises #datacenters.

#Cloud at least makes the bill a whole lot clearer. But as studies have noted, cloud is so elastic that it takes great discipline to even have price parity.

@sarbjeetjohal @DigitalColmer @AshokNellikar But realizing true #serverless with our enterprise data is going to be one of the hardest-ever issues to resolve.

Petabit network connections or quantum may be the key. Or something new. When that happens, the world will change again.

#cloud 

2/2
@JeffBezos Good to see this. But @blueorigin should still go to the moon. It is well past time to only do space things because the government wants to do them.

@sarbjeetjohal @DigitalColmer @AshokNellikar I’d argue that one can write #serverless functions not dependent on #cloud services specifics. Those should be config time to reduce lock-in.

And really, that’s a major benefit of the whole model: Move your algorithms to the public cloud — and around the cloud — with no changes.

@DigitalColmer @sarbjeetjohal @AshokNellikar The enterprise does very much care about #cloud lock-in. Which I can attest from many a #CIO convo, even in Fortune 100 orgs.

#Serverless indeed a big step towards a path of lower lock-in. But it does not resolve the prime issue: #DataGravity. That’s the main obstacle to choice.

Q6) When would you use POC vs an MVP approach?

(I always like adding a question, and so far @MylesSuer doesn't seem to object.) 

#CIOChat #cio

A5: I'd ask at a minimum that a POC demonstrate

- A yes/no on the hypothesis it was created to test
- Time to value estimate if used more broadly
- Does it improve the Iron Triangle over other methods?

#CIOChat #cio #innovation

A4: Ask #tech vendors to participate in a proof of concept when:

- Suitability is uncertain
- Cost/ease-of-implementation hard to estimate
- Promise is high but perceived feasibility in question
- The #IT team needs to validate skills required
- #Tech is unproven

#CIOChat #cio

A3: The real, practical answer to a lot of #ROI in #IT is that the net value is readily obvious to most observers. Or the POC won't move forward to rollout.

But the gold standard is to measure the POC against the existing method w/ already captured business #KPIs.

#CIOChat #cio

A2: Yes, a #POC is an invaluable pathfinder for requirements not just on #innovation projects, but any domain that is new, unknown, untested, unproven, etc.

It's just key to keep in mind that a POC alone is not sufficient for gathering requirements. 

#CIOChat #cio

A1: A proof of concept is good candidate whenever:

- The #tech/solution is new to the industry or org
- The design/approach needs inexpensive validation
- A vendor is new to the org
- The team is new to the #tech 

#CIOChat #cio #servicedelivery #POC

Fast feedback loops.

A5: Ideally, I'd want a senior account manager that knows all the ways the #cloud vendor has contracts with and points of presence across my organization.

That way we can intelligently and in context negotiate +  reach the right deal.

 #CIOChat #cio #procurement

A4: High frustration tactics with #cloud vendors:

- Take it or leave it
- Selling to the business + ignoring #IT
- Making repeated assurances not in contract
- Not admitting problems in last contract term

Sadly, best strategy to overcome is calling someone else.

#CIOChat #cio

@mthiele10 @xianritchie @Adam_Mansfield_ Right. You probably can't change the #SLA, but you can generally understand if the performance range is in or out of target for your needs.

#CIOChat #cio #cloud

@davidseidl @Adam_Mansfield_ @MylesSuer @mthiele10 Oh, this in spades. #IT forgets to even ask about roadmap often, because so few vendors will provide it. In this way, #Azure is one of the better #cloud vendors in this regard, because they often have these.

#CIOChat #cio #procurement

A3: Preparing for a #cloud negotiation:

- Gather and gauge your three year needs
- Full org-wide requirements in scope for the deal
- A recent check-in with the #CFO (who plays bad cop)
- A clear understanding of budget available
- Prior #SLA history
- Gut check

#CIOChat #cio

@davidseidl @Adam_Mansfield_ @MylesSuer Also, it's sometimes hard to tease apart #cloud #SLAs and business requirements. They can be the same thing in key cases.

#CIOChat #cio #IT #procurement

@davidseidl @Adam_Mansfield_ @MylesSuer Ah, actual business requirements at #1. You must not be in #IT. ;-)

#CIOChat #cio

A2: My take on #cloud deal terms priority:

- #SLAs 
- #Dataprotection/backup
- #DR/#BCP capabilities <-- up 3 since #COVID
- #Dataresidency
- Price
- #GreenIT/#CSR compliance
- Flexibility
- Price protection

#CIOChat #cio

@_jfeldman Yes, #dataresidency and #datasovereignty two big issues that many small and medium-sized #CSPs have challenges addressing unless they have been cross-licensing a lot of #colo with other #CSPs around the world.

#CIOChat #cio #cloud

@Adam_Mansfield_ Yes, optimal is where you start with #cloud deals.

Then you go as close from there as you can keep it near that point.

But the real challenge is that you start with the boilerplate from the provider, not a clean sheet of paper.

#CIOChat #cio #procurement

@_jfeldman @rwang0 Oh, that's the key question. #CSPs totally willing to negotiate, especially w/ F500 orgs. 

But I've talked personally with F10 CIOs who say they can;t get the #hyperscalers (#AWS, #Azure, #CP) to vary anything in contracts.

Their economies of scale too big to change.

#CIOChat

A1: An "optimal" -- which is very much in the eye of the beholder -- #cloud deal:

- Aggressive #SLAs
- Strict #dataprotection clauses
- Guarantees of services in current version during contract
- Reasonable ability to mod contract
- Easy out if better deal found

A5: The big opportunities in #ecosystem are:

- Turning the business into a healthy + sustainable one
- Breaking down barriers to participation, growth, diversity, sustainability
- Creating new markets + unimagined opportunities at scale
- Giving back w/ them

#STinsights #OneHCL

The frustrating answer is the usual one: It depends. But the rule of thumb is focusing most #innovation on incremental improvements w/ some minority, (10-20%) aimed at Big Bang-style moonshots. Just don’t bet the farm. Swing and missing is common + OK.

#STinsights #OneHCL

A4: #Ecosystems very different than previous stakeholder networks. They are:

- Less predictable
- Harder to direct/control
- Create unintended consequences (good and bad)

But they are also far more innovative, scalable, and sustainable than any other way.

#STinsights #OneHCL

A3: Business are responding by:

- Investing in cultivating #ecosystems + #community
- Educating their workers on how to harness them
- Positioning them more centrally within their #businessmodels 
- Using them for #digitaltransformation 

#STinsights #OneHCL

A core reason why it’s vital not to cut spending on #talent, #innovation, or #collaboration during a crisis. It’s these very things that get orgs out of the situation they are in longer term. Short term, it’s very difficult to do this, but vitally important.

#STinsights #OneHCL

@aayu_bajaj @anandnswamy @AshildHanne @enricomolinari @nigewillson @omarassil @CIOStraightTalk Both #ethics and #trust are critical to sustain #innovation. @DigitalSecArch @CIOStraightTalk With an ecosystem you get both planned and emergent #innovation. Brands can use it directly and deliberately, but there is usually so much of it, there’s plenty left over to the whole ecosystem to benefit.

- Better diversity

First, don't let bad data in.

Use #datamanagement to clean it up + normalize it.

- #BI, #analytics, #AI
- Open #APIs/#microservices
- Data lakes

People, process, technology, in that order. What it's always been about.

A2: Best ways to create #data advantage:

- Cultivate open #masterdata
- Cull data silos
- Invest in #datamanagement 
- Provide self-service #data access + #analytics
- Publish #microservices-based business graph/API
- Educate, evangelize
- Storytell data successes

A4: I believe that the bottom line is that the #CIO should generally be in alignment with the organization's overall #CSR goals/strategy when it comes to sustainability. They can lead out ahead of course, and often should, but alignment is their prime responsibility.

#CIOChat

A3: Short version: CIOs should include high @iFixit repairability scores in procurement requirements.

#CIOChat #BCP #sustainabilty #GreenIT 

2/2

A3:  A big answer is in repairability / reusability. Business continuity + sustainability is improved when a worker drops their tablet, cracks the screen, and a repair service can replace it and puts it back in service the same day.

#CIOChat  1/2

@simoncrosby @adrianco The best incentive is that customers demand it. I do see that #Genz is far more inclined to be socially responsible in this way. But it'll be a while before a lot of CIOs are from that age group.

#CIOChat #cio #GreenIT #renewableenergy

@topicm @MylesSuer And #carbonneutral and other #GreenIT goals are just not high priority yet. Even the #cloud providers are setting 2030 or beyond as their target. It will happen. But slowly. I expect regulation, ironically spurred by #cryptomining power use, will spur this a bit.

#CIOChat

A2: Biggest opps for #GreenIT, in rough order:

- Limit #cloud/#SaaS utilization to 100% #carbonneutral or negative providers
- Only buy easily recycled endpoint + infrastructure devices
- Dispose of all physical #IT at IT recycling centers
- Buy renewable power

#CIOChat #cio

A1: I don't see as much on carbon neutrality in #IT outside of the top #cloud vendors. That's where I expect the most progress w/ orgs like @Apple, @Microsoft, @Amazon, and even @Unilever committing to it.

Since so much #IT will be in cloud, this is the top route IMO.
